definitions.definition: To draw together or nearer; to shorten, narrow, or lessen.
definitions.example: The snail's body contracted into its shell.

definitions.definition: (grammar) To shorten by omitting a letter or letters or by reducing two or more vowels or syllables to one.
definitions.example: The word "cannot" is often contracted into "can't".

definitions.definition: To enter into a contract with.
To enter into, with mutual obligations; to make a bargain or covenant for.
To make an agreement or contract; to covenant; to agree; to bargain.
definitions.example: to contract for carrying the mail

definitions.definition: To bring on; to incur; to acquire.
definitions.example: She contracted the habit of smoking in her teens.

definitions.definition: To draw together so as to wrinkle; to knit.
The act of something that contracts or shrinks; contraction.
Work done on a contract basis.
Getting smaller; drawing itself together into a smaller area.
